meta.title: Vert.x 3.2.0 is released!
meta.summary: We are pleased to announce the release of Vert.x 3.2.0!

meta.title: Automatic redeployment in Eclipse IDE
meta.summary: Vert.x 3.1 has (re-)introduced the redeploy feature. This blog post explains how to use this feature in the Eclipse IDE. However, you can easily adapt the content to your IDE.

meta.title: Combine vert.x and mongo to build a giant
meta.summary: This blog post is part of the introduction to Vert.x series. We are now going to replace this JDBC client by the vertx-mongo-client, and thus connect to a Mongo database.

meta.title: Things to keep in mind concerning CSRF attacks
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x like most frameworks provides an anti-CSRF defense. However, no framework can prevent all attack vectors that exist in the web. Therefore, developers need to be aware of some dangers and common attack vectors concerning CSRF defenses.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x metrics now with Micrometer.io
meta.summary: The new vertx-micrometer-metrics module provides support for collecting metrics with Micrometer.io and storing them in backends such as Graphite or InfluxDB.

meta.title: Unit and Integration Tests
meta.summary: Let’s refresh our mind about what we developed so far in the introduction to vert.x series. We forgot an important task. We didn’t test the API.
